required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MSB0254 Injection in Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of MSB0254 Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This study was an open, multi-dose dose escalation phase I clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and PK characteristics of MSB0254 in patients with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors, and to preliminarily measure its anti-tumor efficacy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days following the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by number adverse events that are related to treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose(MTD) or recommended phase2 dose（RP2D）
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days following the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by number of subjects experiencing DLT in each escalation cohort

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) for MSB0254
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days following the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in AUC over time in subjects with MSB0254

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days following the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to the Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days following the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time in hours/days to reach Cmax following dosing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days following the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: The time required for the plasma level of the study drug to decrease by one-half during the terminal elimination phase

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days following the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of MSB0254 injection was evaluated by testing the production of anti-drug antibody (ADA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (ORR) as measured by RESISTv1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days following the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of response (DOR) as measured by RESISTv1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days following the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival (PFS) as measured by RESISTv1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days following the last dose

arm_group.description: This experiment will start from 4mg/kg with a dose increase of 3+3, and is planned to be carried out in 5 dose groups, namely 4mg/kg, 8mg/kg (100% increase), 12mg/kg (50% increase), 16mg/kg (33% increase) and 20mg/kg (25% increase).MSB0254 injection was administered intravenously on day 1 and day 15 every 28 days.To collect pharmacokinetic blood samples after repeated administration, MSB0254 injection was not administered on day 1 of the third cycle (C3D1).The observation period of DLT was 28 days after the first administration.

intervention.description: An intravenous infusion with concentration from 4 mg/kg to 20 mg/kg every 2 weeks (Q2W).
